metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17008 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When using nested workers, a use-after-free could occur during workerdestruction. This resulted in a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, Firefox ESR < 68.3, and Firefox <71.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
